thread.title: Flyers' Jakub Voracek shares his unique Kimmo Timonen Cup story
thread.title_full: Flyers' Jakub Voracek shares his unique Kimmo Timonen Cup story | NJ.com

author: Randy Miller | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Flyers' Jakub Voracek shares his unique Kimmo Timonen Cup story
text:
PHILADELPHIA â€” Flyers right wing Jakub Voracek played all 82 games last season, then headed straight home to the Czech Republic to represent his country in the World Championships.
In need of some R&R after that, Voracek and his girlfriend traveled to Rome in early June for a vacation ... and that's where he was when beloved former teammate Kimmo Timonen won the Stanley Cup with the Chicago Blackhawks.
ALSO: Neuvirth in goal again vs. Chicago Blackhawks
Voracek made sure that he watched the end of the Blackhawks' clincher in Game 6 of the Stanley Cup Final.
"I put a wake-up call for 4 a.m. for the last 10 minutes of the game just in case Chicago wins," Voracek said. "They were up 1-0. I watched and saw Patrick Kane score the second goal. The only reason I watched it was become of Kimmo."
Watching on his laptop last June, Voracek loved seeing Timonen raise the Cup.
"I was so happy for that because, let's be honest, he really deserves it," Voracek said. "He gave a lot to the game and he finally got rewarded in the NHL. It was something fantastic. To watch him raise the Cup and watch him be so happy ... for what he'd done for that, it was incredible."
Voracek played three seasons in Philadelphia with Timonen, who missed most of last season recovering from blood clots. Before playing his first game, he was traded to Chicago on Feb. 27, went on to win the Cup and then retired at age 40.
"I don't think it could happen to a better player and person than Kimmo," Voracek said. "I'm sure this whole locker room was cheering for Chicago last year."
Voracek was a little envious. He says seeing Timonen win a Cup makes him hungrier to do it.
"A hundred percent," he said. "Let's be honest, it's why we play the sport. To win it here one day would be something incredible."
